channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Older Versions of Webex Desktop App Going End-of-Life May 30
item.description: DotCIO’s Multimedia Services would like to make the Rensselaer community aware that version 43.7 and earlier of the Webex Desktop App will reach end of life on Thursday, May 30. File a support request with the Help Desk if you need help making sure the app is fully up-to-date!
item.author: Community

item.title: Webex Education Connector to Automatically Migrate to Webex LTI Legacy June 2
item.description: Multimedia Services would like to inform the Rensselaer community that the Webex Education Connector used to connect Webex and Blackboard will be automatically migrated to Webex LTI Legacy on Sunday, June 2, 2024. Please refer to the “Authorization Error in LMS Webex Education Connector” ITSSC article for more information if you need to reauthorize the connection.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Host Systems Engineering & Technology Management Review
item.description: Date: Tuesday, June 4, 2024 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., this information session focuses on Rensselaer’s flexible, project-based, online Systems Engineering and Technology Management graduate degree that will help prepare decision-makers with broader and deeper capabilities in leading dynamic organizations. Please register if you plan to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: American Music Festival to be Held June 7-8
item.description: Presented by Albany Symphony Orchestra and scheduled to be held throughout Troy June 7-8, this festival will feature composer workshops and rehearsal readings, post-concert musical mingling at Evelyn’s Cafe, recitals, Dogs of Desire on Friday, the culminating Festival concert on Saturday, and more.
item.author: Community

item.title: CCPD, Sidewalk Warriors to Offer Civic Engagement Opportunity June 13
item.description: Beginning at 4:30PM on Thursday, June 13 at the United Methodist Church in downtown Troy, the Center for Career and Professional Development and participating students will be volunteering with Sidewalk Warriors, an organization dedicated to serving individuals in our community who are facing food insecurity, homelessness, and mental illness. Please come support those in need and help make a positive impact!
item.author: Students

item.title: Fidelity to Hold Confidential In-Person Retirement Consultations June 17
item.description:
Date: Monday, June 17, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - Schedule a confidential consultation to help you become better informed and more confident about your workplace retirement savings plan benefits!

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
